verbLexeme: 1. Of a source of light, to appear suddenly and then disappear. English = flash.
2. Of a source of sound, to give out a noise for a short period of time.
nominalLexeme: 1. A sudden brief appearance of light. English = flash.
2. A sudden brief sound, usually loud; a burst of sound; a blast of noise.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: a flashing energy source.
